intro: Echium canaliculatum, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have shallow notches, while the stems are hairy and upright. Echium canaliculatum is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
